answers.answer: Hi!In all probability it means that there were bright or hyperintense brain areas on MRI which are commonly seen in migraines and seizures. They usually indicate small vessel ischemic disease or changes of brain blood vessels. These changes are seen in multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer's or Wilson's Disease, migraine headaches, diabetes, high blood pressure and high cholesterol. You can discuss this in detail with your mother’s doctor. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: my mom suffers from migraine headaches and seizures, on her MRI she was told there is a lot of white matter. Which was not explained to her as to what it could mean. Can you please help by an explanation to this if at all possible. thank you
title: MRI white matter ...what it means
